titles: By the Lord Protector. A proclamation commanding all papists, and all other persons who have been of the late Kings party, or his sons, to repair unto their place of abode, and not to remove above five miles from the same.
author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1658-1660 : R. Cromwell)
Cromwell, Richard, 1626-1712.
publisher: Printed by Henry Hills and John Field, Printers to His Highness, 1659. And are to be sold at the seven Stars in Fleetstreet over against Dunstans Church,
notes: Dated at end: Given at Whitehall the three and twentieth day of April, in the year of our Lord, 1659.
Thomason copy imperfect; sheet cropped on right side, with loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Exile (Punishment) --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
Royalists --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
Catholics --  England --  London --  Legal status, laws, etc. --  Early works to 1800.
